content.description:
Thin is the name of the game on this balancy route. Start on some big holds that are fairly reachy then move to the thin stuff.

The crux comes about in the middle off of teeny tiny crimps to a balancy slopping side pull/undercling. Then to more reasonably small crimps.

Did I mention the food work? Bring that too. Good feet are few and far between. Tricky and fun route.
content.protection: 7 bolts to two anchors with chains.
content.location:
Go up to the top of the Chamber. It's the fifth to the last bolted route, and it is right of

Green Lantern

(the route that's covered in green rock).

climbs.name: Sanctus
climbs.fa: T. Wilhelmi, K. Gibson, J. Bowes

content.description: This is a good route with every kind of hold imaginable (crimps, slopers, jugs, side pulls, underclings). Good rock and variety make this tricky and sustained route. Overall, however, it seemed a bit contrived.
content.protection: 12 bolts (very well protected) to a pair of anchors with large fixed links.
content.location:
This route is about the middle part of the Chamber. Just to the left of

Drawn and Quartered

. Look at the photo.

content.description:
This route starts off with a bang.  The first few clips through thin face climbing is the crux.  After reaching the small ledge, continue on hard 5.10 climbing up and left to the anchors.

Beware of some loose blocks.  When I did this route, I almost pulled off a 30 pounder off on the small ledge above the crux.
content.location:
This is the first route around the corner to the left of

Churchill

.

content.description: I have a love hate relationship with this route. On one hand, it has some fantastic moves and great holds. But these areas of bliss are interrupted by broken and dirty rock. This route also checks in at one of the longest on the Chamber Wall, which definitely makes a difference as you work to crux sequence at the very end. The majority of the route is vertical until the end when it steepens for the last 15 ft or so. If this route cleans up more, it could get another star.
content.protection: 13 bolts to a pair of anchors with chains. Helmet might be nice. Use a 60m rope for sure and tie a knot in the end (like you know you should anyway).
content.location:
This route is the last one (maybe) before moving to the upper Chamber, just to the left of

Sanctus

. Look at the photo.

climbs.name: The Rack
climbs.fa: T. Wilhelmi, J. Bowes, C. Wilhelmi

content.description:
This route is touted as having no moves harder than 5.9, but that might be a little bit of a stretch.  This route follows continuously thin climbing on a somewhat slabby wall to the left of the

Jester

.  A very pumpy route....
content.location:
This is the [fourth] route to the left of

Churchill

.

climbs.name: Poudre Pie
climbs.fa: D. Peavey, J. Doyle, T. Wihelmi

content.description: Start by the dead tree near the top of the Upper Chamber Wall (this is the last bolted route on the face). Climb jugs past three bolts before committing to the blunt, lichen-coated prow above. This route has excellent, technical-climbing on suprisingly big holds. Fun fun fun. A bit harder than Small Fry in my opinion.
content.location: This is the last route on Upper Chamber Wall - labeled route # 55 in the NC3 Poudre Canyon Guide.

content.description:
This is located between '

Big Mac

' and '

Green Lantern

' in the Upper Chamber. The crux comes at the 3rd bolt. Good stone and fun moves for the first 2/3 of the route leads to a chossy finish. It may feel a bit sporty at times.

A 60 meter rope is mandatory. Helmets are recommended.

This route is an recent addition to the Palace (~2 years old), so there may still be some loose rock.  It makes up for its lack of rock quality with length.  The route is about 98 feet long, so be careful lowering your partner.

Follow 13-14 bolts on continuous 5.10 climbing to a 5.11ish crux at 2/3rd's height.
content.location:
This is the first long route to the left of "

The Rack

".

content.description: This looks like a promising route but alas suffers from Poudre choss syndrome. It is fairly balancy (what?) with some fun reaches. Near about halfway, the route seems to push you off left into the choss with scary holds. If one could stay on the solid rock, the route would be much better.
content.protection: 6-7 draws to two open cold shuts.
content.location:
It is directly to the left of

Road to Redemption

.

content.description: This is another fun 5.10 on this shady wall.  This endurance route angles left to a couple of crack systems.  The crux is finding the easiest way to the leftmost crack.  A variety of jams, liebacks, and face moves make the this long route worthwhile.
content.location:
This is the second route to the left of

Churchill

.

climbs.name: In Between the Sheets
climbs.fa: D. Peavey, J. Doyle, K. Gibson Â‘06

content.description:
This is an undocumented between "

The Rack

" and "

The Jester

".  This pumpy addition has no real crux, but has continuous climbing at the 5.10+ to 5.11- range for 4-5 clips.
content.location:
This is just to the right of "

The Rack

"....

climbs.name: Green Lantern
climbs.fa: T. Wilhelmi, K. Gibson, J. Bowes

content.description: Start with a big move right at the get go. Follow more small holds, on the deceptively steep, green rock, to a sneaky reach crux move about half way up. Continue on steep rock with big holds to the anchors. Take advantage of the BIG no hands rest just before the end of this continuous route.
content.location:
This is directly left of

Small Fry

. It is the fourth? to the last line, going left, in the Upper Chamber.

climbs.name: Drawn and Quartered
climbs.fa: T. Wilhelmi, S. Shannon, J. Bowes

content.description: Plentiful edges for hands and feet lead past 4 bolts to a reachy and balancy 5th clip. Continue up through roof on good holds to clip last bolt and chains.
content.location:
This is the route right of

Sanctus

, midway up Chamber Wall.

climbs.name: Cruiser
climbs.fa: D. Peavey, J. Doyle, T. Wilhelmi

content.description: This is a short, moderate, sport climb. Grade for pumpiness.
content.location:
It is between "

Love It or Hate It

" and "

Drawn and Quartered

."

content.description: 'Churchill Rejects' ascends a narrow, flat face repleat with a variety of features.  It is fun and recreational at the grade.
content.protection: 4 bolts (later extended to '8 or 9' - see comment below) and anchors at top.
content.location: This is found at the very foot of 'The Chamber' Wall, about 20 feet left of the 'Mine'.

content.description: Begin on streaked arete about 15 yards uphill from previous route. Climb the loose broken face right of the shallow depression.
content.location:
This is on The Chamber, left of

Last in Show

.

climbs.name: Big Mac
climbs.fa: D. Peavey, T. Wilhelmi, J. Doyle

content.description: The hard to decipher crux comes low at the third bolt. The climbing eases but stays interesting and difficult for almost the entire length of the climb. It is well-bolted.
content.protection: 13 bolts to a two bolt anchor with chains.
content.location:
This is the second to last route on the left hand side of The Chamber. It is the third route to the left of

Small Fry

and just to the right of

Poudre Pie

.
